events.abstract: The talk is going to be a roundtrip through different different mobile payment products available. It will show how to do a PayPal payment in your Android app with just a few lines of code and how you're able to let the user identify himself via OAuth.
events.title: Pay & Identify with PayPal

events.abstract: Activiti is a lightweight, java-based open-source process engine. This talk is targeted at Java developers interested in moderately to very complex web applications for business or consumer needs. Our aim is to introduce you to the concept of processes and workflows and explore the personal, technical and organizational scenarios for which the use of a process engine like Activiti makes sense. We will also look at some Activiti code samples, offer an introduction to the Activiti codebase and go through the main developer resources.
events.title: Introducing Activiti

events.abstract: After a really short introduction to Bitcoin I will give an overview on BitcoinJ - how it fits in the Software ecosystem, an overview of the API, what kind of Applications are already powered by it, why you should use it and what we can expect in the near future.
events.title: Introduction to BitcoinJ

events.abstract:
go-start is a high level web framework for Google's new programming language Go, like Django for Python or Rails for Ruby.

After an introduction to Go and its unique language features we will deep-dive into go-start. We will create a web application from scratch with Views (based on Go - no extra template language), Controllers and Models (we will use MongoDB as data store).
events.title: The go-start Web Framework (part 1)

events.abstract:
An overview over the various Google+ APIs available at the moment
  • REST API
  • History API
  • Hangouts API
events.title: The Google+ Platform

events.abstract: Hands-on experience with the various tools and toys the Hangouts API has to offer.
events.title: Google+ Hangouts Development

events.abstract: Google Apps Script, first introduced in 2009 as a scripting layer for Google Docs, is in a quite active development right now and matured to the point where it can replace many common tools and offer much faster and easier development. In the talk I'm going to talk about its features, use cases and cover current limitations and issues.
events.title: Apps Script: Google-hosted Javascript

events.abstract: The Google Web Toolkit (GWT) is used to create modern and complex rich Internet applications. By generating JavaScript from Java code, all the advantages of Java are available, while the ever-growing demands of Web users in terms of style, performance, interaction, and browser compatibility of web sites are covered. In the talk, GWT is presented and its use in practice is discussed.
events.title: Google Web Toolkit in practice

events.abstract:
go-start is a high level web framework for Google's new programming language Go, like Django for Python or Rails for Ruby.

After an introduction to Go and its unique language features we will deep-dive into go-start. We will create a web application from scratch with Views (based on Go - no extra template language), Controllers and Models (we will use MongoDB as data store).
events.title: The go-start Web Framework (part 2)
